subject: Ethics
title: The Moral Status of Robots
description: One-minute skill: The Moral Status of Robots.

hook.text: Saudi Arabia granted citizenship to a robot named Sophia. She has more rights than Saudi women did in 2017.

buildup.text: Moral status means deserving ethical consideration. Humans have it. Animals partially. What about machines?

discovery.text: Philosophers tie moral status to sentienceâ€”the ability to suffer. No suffering, no rights needed.

twist.text: But if a robot convincingly acts like it suffers, does our moral obligation changeâ€”even if it's 'just code'?

climax.text: Granting robots rights could protect them. Or it could dilute rights meant for beings that truly suffer.

punchline.text: Rights without suffering is a costume. Or is it?

quiz.question: What do most philosophers consider the basis for moral status?
